q1.justification: Printer paper shows consistent month-over-month increases (120→150→180), representing a 50% increase from January to March.

q2.justification: Engineering shows the highest percentage increase in expenses from Q1 to Q4.

q3.calculation: Safety glasses will need replacement in 1.8 months (200 uses/month with 30 units and 12-month lifespan).
q3.justification: Safety glasses have the highest usage frequency relative to their inventory and lifespan.

q4.justification: Clipboards are below the minimum level and need reordering to reach 75% of max level.

q5.justification: Paper products have the highest turnover rate, indicating efficient inventory management.

q6.justification: Highlighters have the lowest service level, indicating frequent stockouts.

q7.justification: Marketing has the highest potential savings due to the highest average cost per employee.

q8.justification: Supplier C has the highest score due to the best balance of price, delivery, and quality.

q9.justification: Projected consumption and price increase calculated with EOQ model for optimal frequency.

q10.justification: Centralized system reduces processing time, and Pareto principle sets threshold for review.
